intro: Altensteinia hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymus's altensteinia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Central America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
